info.title: Cashfree Payment Gateway APIs
info.description: Cashfree's Payment Gateway APIs provide developers with a streamlined pathway to integrate advanced payment processing capabilities into their applications, platforms and websites.

tags.name: Orders
tags.description: Collection of APIs to create, accept payments and refund for an order.

tags.name: Payment Links
tags.description: Collection of APIs handle payment links.

tags.name: Token Vault
tags.description: Cashfree's token Vault helps you save cards and tokenize them in a PCI complaint manner. We support creation of network tokens which can be used across acquiring banks

tags.name: softPOS
tags.description: softPOS' agent and order management system now supported by APIs

tags.name: Offers
tags.description: Collection of apis to get offers applicable for an order

tags.name: Eligibility APIs
tags.description: Collection of apis to fetch eligible payment methods for customer and order

tags.name: Settlement Reconciliation
tags.description: APIs to get detail list about money settled to your account

XPartnerMerchantID.description: If you are partner use this to specify the merchant id if you don't have the merchant client app id

channel.description: The channel for card payments can be "link" or "post". Post is used for seamless OTP payments where merchant captures OTP on their own page.

card_number.description: Customer card number for plain card transactions. Token pan number for tokenized card transactions.

card_holder_name.description: Customer name mentioned on the card.

card_expiry_mm.description: Card expiry month for plain card transactions. Token expiry month for tokenized card transactions.

card_expiry_yy.description: Card expiry year for plain card transactions. Token expiry year for tokenized card transactions.

instrument_id.description: instrument id of saved card. Required only to make payment using saved instrument.

cryptogram.description: cryptogram received from card network. Required only for tokenized card transactions.

token_requestor_id.description: TRID issued by card networks. Required only for tokenized card transactions.

card_display.description: last 4 digits of original card number. Required only for tokenized card transactions.

card_alias.description: Card alias as returned by Cashfree Vault API.

card_bank_name.description: One of ["Kotak", "ICICI", "RBL", "BOB", "Standard Chartered"]. Card bank name, required for EMI payments. This is the bank user has selected for EMI

emi_tenure.description: EMI tenure selected by the user

card_holder_name.description: Customer name mentioned on the card.

card_alias.description: Card alias as returned by Cashfree Vault API

emi_tenure.description: EMI tenure selected by the user

CardPaymentMethod.description: The card payment object is used to make payment using either plain card number, saved card instrument id or using cryptogram

channel.description: The channel for card payments can be "link" or "post". Post is used for seamless OTP payments where merchant captures OTP on their own page.

card_number.description: Customer card number for plain card transactions. Token pan number for tokenized card transactions.

card_holder_name.description: Customer name mentioned on the card.

card_expiry_mm.description: Card expiry month for plain card transactions. Token expiry month for tokenized card transactions.

card_expiry_yy.description: Card expiry year for plain card transactions. Token expiry year for tokenized card transactions.

instrument_id.description: instrument id of saved card. Required only to make payment using saved instrument.

cryptogram.description: cryptogram received from card network. Required only for tokenized card transactions.

emi_tenure.description: EMI tenure for the selected provider. This is mandatory when provider is one of [`hdfc`, `icici`, `cashe`, `idfc`, `kotak`]

link_notify.title: link_notify
link_notify.description: Payment link Notify Object for SMS and Email

send_sms.description: If "true", Cashfree will send sms on customer_phone

send_email.description: If "true", Cashfree will send email on customer_email

link_notes.title: link_notes
link_notes.description: Key-value pair that can be used to store additional information about the entity. Maximum 5 key-value pairs

notify_url.description: Notification URL for server-server communication. It should be an https URL.

upi_intent.description: If "true", link will directly open UPI Intent flow on mobile, and normal link flow elsewhere

return_url.description: The URL to which user will be redirected to after the payment is done on the link. Maximum length: 250.

payment_methods.description: Allowed payment modes for this link. Pass comma-separated values among following options - "cc", "dc", "ccc", "ppc", "nb", "upi", "paypal", "app". Leave it blank to show all available payment methods

link_id.description: Unique Identifier (provided by merchant) for the Link. Alphanumeric and only - and _ allowed (50 character limit). Use this for other link-related APIs.

link_amount.description: Amount to be collected using this link. Provide upto two decimals for paise.

link_currency.description: Currency for the payment link. Default is INR. Contact care@cashfree.com to enable new currencies.

link_purpose.description: A brief description for which payment must be collected. This is shown to the customer.

link_partial_payments.description: If "true", customer can make partial payments for the link.

link_minimum_partial_amount.description: Minimum amount in first installment that needs to be paid by the customer if partial payments are enabled. This should be less than the link_amount.

link_expiry_time.description: Time after which the link expires. Customers will not be able to make the payment beyond the time specified here. You can provide them in a valid ISO 8601 time format. Default is 30 days.

link_notify.title: link_notify
link_notify.description: Payment link Notify Object for SMS and Email

send_sms.description: If "true", Cashfree will send sms on customer_phone

send_email.description: If "true", Cashfree will send email on customer_email

link_auto_reminders.description: If "true", reminders will be sent to customers for collecting payments.

CreateOrderBackendRequest.title: CreateOrderBackendRequest
CreateOrderBackendRequest.description: Request body to create an order at cashfree

order_id.description: Order identifier present in your system. Alphanumeric, '_' and '-' only

order_amount.description: Bill amount for the order. Provide upto two decimals. 10.15 means Rs 10 and 15 paisa

order_currency.description: Currency for the order. INR if left empty. Contact care@cashfree.com to enable new currencies.

allOf.title: CustomerDetails
allOf.description: The customer details that are necessary. Note that you can pass dummy details if your use case does not require the customer details.

customer_id.description: A unique identifier for the customer. Use alphanumeric values only.

customer_bank_account_number.description: Customer bank account. Required if you want to do a bank account check (TPV)

customer_bank_ifsc.description: Customer bank IFSC. Required if you want to do a bank account check (TPV)

customer_bank_code.description: Customer bank code. Required for net banking payments, if you want to do a bank account check (TPV)

allOf.title: Terminal
allOf.description: Use this if you are creating an order for cashfree's softPOS

added_on.description: date time at which terminal is added

last_updated_on.description: last instant when this terminal was updated

terminal_note.description: note given by merchant while creating the terminal

terminal_id.description: The internal id that you use to map the terminal in your internal system

terminal_type.description: To identify the type of terminal product in use, in this case it is SPOS

allOf.title: Get Static QR
allOf.description: QRGet StaticQRs using terminal ID or phone number

bank.description: Name of the bank that is linked to the Static QR.

allOf.title: OrderMeta
allOf.description: Optional meta details to control how the customer pays and how payment journey completes

return_url.description: The URL to which user will be redirected to after the payment on bank OTP page. Maximum length: 250. The return_url must contain placeholder {order_id}. When redirecting the customer back to the return url from the bank’s OTP page, Cashfree will replace this placeholder with the actual value for that order.

notify_url.description: Notification URL for server-server communication. Useful when user's connection drops while re-directing. NotifyUrl should be an https URL. Maximum length: 250.

payment_methods.description: Allowed payment modes for this order. Pass comma-separated values among following options - "cc", "dc", "ccc", "ppc","nb","upi","paypal","app","paylater","cardlessemi","dcemi","ccemi","banktransfer". Leave it blank to show all available payment methods

order_expiry_time.description: Time after which the order expires. Customers will not be able to make the payment beyond the time specified here. We store timestamps in IST, but you can provide them in a valid ISO 8601 time format. Example 2021-07-02T10:20:12+05:30 for IST, 2021-07-02T10:20:12Z for UTC

allOf.description: Custom Tags in thr form of {"key":"value"} which can be passed for an order. A maximum of 10 tags can be added

order_splits.description: If you have Easy split enabled in your Cashfree account then you can use this option to split the order amount.

items.title: VendorSplit
items.description: Use to split order when cashfree's Easy Split is enabled for your account.

example.description: order amount should be more than equal to 100.12

vendor_id.description: Vendor id created in Cashfree system

amount.description: Amount which will be associated with this vendor

percentage.description: Percentage of order amount which shall get added to vendor account

refund_amount.description: Amount to be refunded. Should be lesser than or equal to the transaction amount. (Decimals allowed)

refund_id.description: An unique ID to associate the refund with. Provie alphanumeric values

refund_note.description: A refund note for your reference.

refund_speed.description: Speed at which the refund is processed. It's an optional field with default being STANDARD

items.title: VendorSplit
items.description: Use to split order when cashfree's Easy Split is enabled for your account.

example.description: order amount should be more than equal to 100.12

vendor_id.description: Vendor id created in Cashfree system

amount.description: Amount which will be associated with this vendor

percentage.description: Percentage of order amount which shall get added to vendor account

ErrorDetailsInPaymentsEntity.description: The error details are present only for failed payments

example.error_description: issuer bank or payment service provider declined the transaction

customer_id.description: customer_id for which the instrument was saved

afa_reference.description: cf_payment_id of the successful transaction done while saving instrument

instrument_uid.description: Unique id for the saved instrument

instrument_display.description: masked card number displayed to the customer

created_at.description: Timestamp at which instrument was saved.

card_network.description: card scheme/network of the saved card. Example visa, mastercard

card_bank_name.description: Issuing bank name of saved card

cursor.description: Specifies from where the next set of settlement details should be fetched.

limit.description: Number of settlements you want to fetch in the next iteration.

event_id.description: Unique ID associated with the event.

event_type.description: The event type can be SETTLEMENT, PAYMENT, REFUND, REFUND_REVERSAL, DISPUTE, DISPUTE_REVERSAL, CHARGEBACK, CHARGEBACK_REVERSAL, OTHER_ADJUSTMENT.

event_settlement_amount.description: Amount that is part of the settlement corresponding to the event.

event_amount.description: Amount of the event. Example, refund amount, dispute amount, payment amount, etc.

sale_type.description: Indicates if it is CREDIT/DEBIT sale.

event_status.description: Status of the event. Example - SUCCESS, FAILED, PENDING, CANCELLED.

event_time.description: Time associated with the event. Example, transaction time, dispute initiation time

order_id.description: Unique order ID. Alphanumeric and only '-' and '_' allowed.

order_amount.description: The amount which was passed at the order creation time.

payment_utr.description: Unique transaction reference number of the payment.

payment_time.description: Date and time when the payment was initiated.

payment_service_charge.description: Service charge applicable for the payment.

payment_service_tax.description: Service tax applicable on the payment.

cf_payment_id.description: Cashfree Payments unique ID to identify a payment.

cf_settlement_id.description: Unique ID to identify the settlement.

settlement_date.description: Date and time when the settlement was processed.

settlement_utr.description: Unique transaction reference number of the settlement.

split_service_charge.description: Service charge that is applicable for splitting the payment.

split_service_tax.description: Service tax applicable for splitting the amount to vendors.

vendor_commission.description: Vendor commission applicable for this transaction.

closed_in_favor_of.description: Specifies whether the dispute was closed in favor of the merchant or customer. /n Possible values - Merchant, Customer

dispute_resolved_on.description: Date and time when the dispute was resolved.

dispute_category.description: Category of the dispute - Dispute code and the reason for dispute is shown.

refund_processed_at.description: Date and time when the refund was processed.

refund_arn.description: The bank reference number for the refund.

refund_note.description: A refund note for your reference.

refund_id.description: An unique ID to associate the refund with.

adjustment.description: Amount that is adjusted from the settlement amount because of any credit/debit event such as refund, refund_reverse etc.

service_tax.description: Service tax applicable on the settlement amount.

service_charge.description: Service charge applicable on the settlement amount.

amount_settled.description: Net amount that is settled after considering the adjustments, settlement charge and tax.

payment_from.description: The start time of the time range of the payments considered for the settlement.

payment_till.description: The end time of time range of the payments considered for the settlement.

settlement_initiated_on.description: Date and time when the settlement was initiated.

settlement_type.description: Type of settlement. Possible values - Standard, Instant, On demand.

settlement_charge.description: Settlement charges applicable on the settlement.

settlement_tax.description: Settlement tax applicable on the settlement.

limit.description: Number of settlements you want to fetch in the next iteration. Maximum limit is 1000, default value is 10.

cursor.description: Specifies from where the next set of settlement details should be fetched.

pagination.description:
To fetch the next set of settlements, pass the cursor received in the response to the next API call. 
 To receive the data for the first time, pass the cursor as null. 
 Limit would be number of settlements that you want to receive.

start_date.description: Specify the start date from when you want the settlement reconciliation details.

end_date.description: Specify the end date till when you want the settlement reconciliation details.

oneOf.description: The card payment object is used to make payment using either plain card number, saved card instrument id or using cryptogram

channel.description: The channel for card payments can be "link" or "post". Post is used for seamless OTP payments where merchant captures OTP on their own page.

card_number.description: Customer card number for plain card transactions. Token pan number for tokenized card transactions.

card_holder_name.description: Customer name mentioned on the card.

card_expiry_mm.description: Card expiry month for plain card transactions. Token expiry month for tokenized card transactions.

card_expiry_yy.description: Card expiry year for plain card transactions. Token expiry year for tokenized card transactions.

instrument_id.description: instrument id of saved card. Required only to make payment using saved instrument.

cryptogram.description: cryptogram received from card network. Required only for tokenized card transactions.

token_requestor_id.description: TRID issued by card networks. Required only for tokenized card transactions.

card_display.description: last 4 digits of original card number. Required only for tokenized card transactions.

card_alias.description: Card alias as returned by Cashfree Vault API.

card_bank_name.description: One of ["Kotak", "ICICI", "RBL", "BOB", "Standard Chartered"]. Card bank name, required for EMI payments. This is the bank user has selected for EMI

emi_tenure.description: EMI tenure selected by the user

Customer UPI VPA to process payment. 
### Important
This is a required parameter for channel = `collect`

upi_redirect_url.description:
use this if you want cashfree to show a loader. Sample response below. It is only supported for collect
`action:collect` will be returned with `data.url` having the link for redirection

xIdempotencyKeyHeader.name: x-idempotency-key
xIdempotencyKeyHeader.description:
Idempotency works by saving the resulting status code and body of the first request made for any given idempotency key, regardless of whether it succeeded or failed. Subsequent requests with the same key return the same result, including 500 errors.

Currently supported on all POST calls that uses x-client-id & x-client-secret. To use enable, pass x-idempotency-key in the request header. The value of this header must be unique to each operation you are trying to do. One example can be to use the same order_id that you pass while creating orders

schema.title: CreateOrderBackendRequest
schema.description: Request body to create an order at cashfree

order_id.description: Order identifier present in your system. Alphanumeric, '_' and '-' only

order_amount.description: Bill amount for the order. Provide upto two decimals. 10.15 means Rs 10 and 15 paisa

order_currency.description: Currency for the order. INR if left empty. Contact care@cashfree.com to enable new currencies.

allOf.title: CustomerDetails
allOf.description: The customer details that are necessary. Note that you can pass dummy details if your use case does not require the customer details.

customer_id.description: A unique identifier for the customer. Use alphanumeric values only.

customer_bank_account_number.description: Customer bank account. Required if you want to do a bank account check (TPV)

customer_bank_ifsc.description: Customer bank IFSC. Required if you want to do a bank account check (TPV)

customer_bank_code.description: Customer bank code. Required for net banking payments, if you want to do a bank account check (TPV)

allOf.title: Terminal
allOf.description: Use this if you are creating an order for cashfree's softPOS

added_on.description: date time at which terminal is added

last_updated_on.description: last instant when this terminal was updated

terminal_note.description: note given by merchant while creating the terminal

terminal_id.description: The internal id that you use to map the terminal in your internal system

terminal_type.description: To identify the type of terminal product in use, in this case it is SPOS

allOf.title: Get Static QR
allOf.description: QRGet StaticQRs using terminal ID or phone number

bank.description: Name of the bank that is linked to the Static QR.

allOf.title: OrderMeta
allOf.description: Optional meta details to control how the customer pays and how payment journey completes

return_url.description: The URL to which user will be redirected to after the payment on bank OTP page. Maximum length: 250. The return_url must contain placeholder {order_id}. When redirecting the customer back to the return url from the bank’s OTP page, Cashfree will replace this placeholder with the actual value for that order.

notify_url.description: Notification URL for server-server communication. Useful when user's connection drops while re-directing. NotifyUrl should be an https URL. Maximum length: 250.

payment_methods.description: Allowed payment modes for this order. Pass comma-separated values among following options - "cc", "dc", "ccc", "ppc","nb","upi","paypal","app","paylater","cardlessemi","dcemi","ccemi","banktransfer". Leave it blank to show all available payment methods

order_expiry_time.description: Time after which the order expires. Customers will not be able to make the payment beyond the time specified here. We store timestamps in IST, but you can provide them in a valid ISO 8601 time format. Example 2021-07-02T10:20:12+05:30 for IST, 2021-07-02T10:20:12Z for UTC

allOf.description: Custom Tags in thr form of {"key":"value"} which can be passed for an order. A maximum of 10 tags can be added

order_splits.description: If you have Easy split enabled in your Cashfree account then you can use this option to split the order amount.

items.title: VendorSplit
items.description: Use to split order when cashfree's Easy Split is enabled for your account.

example.description: order amount should be more than equal to 100.12

vendor_id.description: Vendor id created in Cashfree system

amount.description: Amount which will be associated with this vendor

percentage.description: Percentage of order amount which shall get added to vendor account

order_minimum.description: Minimum set of parameters needed to create an order at cashfree

order_orderid.description: You should always send `order_id`. If not sent Cashfree will generate one for you. This is useful during other api calls

order_with_return_url.description: add a return url to your order

order_with_webhook_url.description: Cashfree will send webhook here if specified. Read more [here](https://docs.cashfree.com/docs/pg-webhooks)

order_with_payment_methods.description: add payment methods, customer can pnly pay using these payment methods only

order_expiry.summary: With future expiry time for order
order_expiry.description: Add an exipry time for your order. No transactions would be accepted after the order has expired

order_note.description: Add an additional note for your order which you can later use. It has to be string. For more detailed data use `order_tags`

order_tags.description: Add key value pairs to your order. Can be used later in your workflow

order_splits_amount.description: Create an order where the amount received will be split between vendor and merchant based on absolute amount.

order_splits_cent.description:
Create an order where the amount received will be split between vendors and merchant based on percentage.
In the below example order amount, let us say INR 200 will be divided like this
- 33% to merchant becomes INR 66 
- 20% to Jane becomes INR 40
- 47% to Barbie becomes INR 94

post.description:
### Order
An order is an entity which has a amount and currency associated with it. It is something for which you want to collect payment for.
Use this API to create orders with Cashfree from your backend to get a `payment_sessions_id`. 
You can use the `payment_sessions_id` to create a transaction for the order.

parameters.description: API version to be used. Format is in YYYY-MM-DD

parameters.description:
Idempotency works by saving the resulting status code and body of the first request made for any given idempotency key, regardless of whether it succeeded or failed. Subsequent requests with the same key return the same result, including 500 errors.

Currently supported on all POST calls that uses x-client-id & x-client-secret. To use enable, pass x-idempotency-key in the request header. The value of this header must be unique to each operation you are trying to do. One example can be to use the same order_id that you pass while creating orders

order_note.description: Add an additional note for your order which you can later use. It has to be string. For more detailed data use `order_tags`

order_splits_amount.description: Create an order where the amount received will be split between vendor and merchant based on absolute amount.

order_splits_cent.description:
Create an order where the amount received will be split between vendors and merchant based on percentage.
In the below example order amount, let us say INR 200 will be divided like this
- 33% to merchant becomes INR 66 
- 20% to Jane becomes INR 40
- 47% to Barbie becomes INR 94

order_invoice.description: Add invoice details for your order

order_customer_tpv.description: Customer with bank details if provided he or she can pay by only that bank account

schema.title: OrdersEntity
schema.description: The complete order entity

cf_order_id.description: unique id generated by cashfree for your order

order_id.description: order_id sent during the api request

order_currency.description: Currency of the order. Example INR

order_status.description:
Possible values are 
- `ACTIVE`: Order does not have a sucessful transaction yet
- `PAID`: Order is PAID with one successful transaction
- `EXPIRED`: Order was not PAID and not it has expired. No transaction can be initiated for an EXPIRED order.

created_at.description: When the order was created at cashfree's server

customer_details.title: CustomerDetails
customer_details.description: The customer details that are necessary. Note that you can pass dummy details if your use case does not require the customer details.

customer_id.description: A unique identifier for the customer. Use alphanumeric values only.

customer_bank_account_number.description: Customer bank account. Required if you want to do a bank account check (TPV)

customer_bank_ifsc.description: Customer bank IFSC. Required if you want to do a bank account check (TPV)

customer_bank_code.description: Customer bank code. Required for net banking payments, if you want to do a bank account check (TPV)

order_meta.title: OrderMeta
order_meta.description: Optional meta details to control how the customer pays and how payment journey completes

return_url.description: The URL to which user will be redirected to after the payment on bank OTP page. Maximum length: 250. The return_url must contain placeholder {order_id}. When redirecting the customer back to the return url from the bank’s OTP page, Cashfree will replace this placeholder with the actual value for that order.

notify_url.description: Notification URL for server-server communication. Useful when user's connection drops while re-directing. NotifyUrl should be an https URL. Maximum length: 250.

payment_methods.description: Allowed payment modes for this order. Pass comma-separated values among following options - "cc", "dc", "ccc", "ppc","nb","upi","paypal","app","paylater","cardlessemi","dcemi","ccemi","banktransfer". Leave it blank to show all available payment methods

payments.title: PaymentURLObject
payments.description: URL for payment retrieval for an order

refunds.title: RefundURLObject
refunds.description: URL to get refunds for order

order_tags.description: Custom Tags in thr form of {"key":"value"} which can be passed for an order. A maximum of 10 tags can be added

payment_completion_time.description: This is the time when the payment reaches its terminal state

start_time.description: Start time of this authorization hold (only for UPI)

end_time.description: End time of this authorization hold (only for UPI)

approve_by.description: Approve by time as passed in the authorization request (only for UPI)

action_reference.description: CAPTURE or VOID reference number based on action

post.description:
Use this API when you have already created the orders and want Cashfree to process the payment. To use this API S2S flag needs to be enabled
from the backend. In case you want to use the cards payment option the PCI
DSS flag is required, for more information send an email to "care@cashfree.com".

parameters.name: x-api-version
parameters.description: API version to be used. Format is in YYYY-MM-DD

schema.description: API version to be used

parameters.name: x-request-id
parameters.description: Request id for the API call. Can be used to resolve tech issues. Communicate this in your tech related queries to cashfree

requestBody.description: Request body to create a transaction at cashfree using `payment_session_id`

schema.title: OrderPayRequest
schema.description: Complete object for the pay api that uses payment method objects

oneOf.title: CardPaymentMethod
oneOf.description: The card payment object is used to make payment using either plain card number, saved card instrument id or using cryptogram

channel.description: The channel for card payments can be "link" or "post". Post is used for seamless OTP payments where merchant captures OTP on their own page.

card_number.description: Customer card number for plain card transactions. Token pan number for tokenized card transactions.

card_holder_name.description: Customer name mentioned on the card.

card_expiry_mm.description: Card expiry month for plain card transactions. Token expiry month for tokenized card transactions.

card_expiry_yy.description: Card expiry year for plain card transactions. Token expiry year for tokenized card transactions.

instrument_id.description: instrument id of saved card. Required only to make payment using saved instrument.

cryptogram.description: cryptogram received from card network. Required only for tokenized card transactions.

token_requestor_id.description: TRID issued by card networks. Required only for tokenized card transactions.

card_display.description: last 4 digits of original card number. Required only for tokenized card transactions.

card_alias.description: Card alias as returned by Cashfree Vault API.

card_bank_name.description: One of ["Kotak", "ICICI", "RBL", "BOB", "Standard Chartered"]. Card bank name, required for EMI payments. This is the bank user has selected for EMI

emi_tenure.description: EMI tenure selected by the user

oneOf.title: UPIPaymentMethod
oneOf.description: Complete payment method for UPI collect

channel.description: Specify the channel through which the payment must be processed. Can be one of ["link", "collect", "qrcode"]

upi_id.description:
Customer UPI VPA to process payment. 
### Important
This is a required parameter for channel = `collect`

upi_redirect_url.description:
use this if you want cashfree to show a loader. Sample response below. It is only supported for collect
`action:collect` will be returned with `data.url` having the link for redirection

upi_expiry_minutes.description: The UPI request will be valid for this expiry minutes. This parameter is only applicable for a UPI collect payment. The default value is 5 minutes. You should keep the minimum as 5 minutes, and maximum as 15 minutes

authorize_only.description: For one time mandate on UPI. Set this as authorize_only = true. Please note that you can only use the "collect" channel if you are sending a one time mandate request

authorization.title: UPIAuthorizeDetails
authorization.description: object when you are using preauth in UPI in order pay

approve_by.description: Time by which this authorization should be approved by the customer.

start_time.description: This is the time when the UPI one time mandate will start

end_time.description: This is the time when the UPI mandate will be over. If the mandate has not been executed by this time, the funds will be returned back to the customer after this time.

oneOf.title: NetBankingPaymentMethod
oneOf.description: Payment method for netbanking object

channel.description: The channel for netbanking will always be `link`

oneOf.title: AppPaymentMethod
oneOf.description: App payment method

channel.description: Specify the channel through which the payment must be processed.

provider.description: Specify the provider through which the payment must be processed.

phone.description: Customer phone number associated with a wallet for payment.

oneOf.title: CardEMIPaymentMethod
oneOf.description: Complete card emi payment method

channel.description: The channel for card payments will always be "link"

card_holder_name.description: Customer name mentioned on the card.

card_alias.description: Card alias as returned by Cashfree Vault API

card_bank_name.description: Card bank name, required for EMI payments. This is the bank user has selected for EMI. One of ["hdfc, "kotak", "icici", "rbl", "bob", "standard chartered", "axis", "au", "yes", "sbi", "fed", "hsbc", "citi", "amex"]

emi_tenure.description: EMI tenure selected by the user

oneOf.title: CardlessEMIPaymentMethod
oneOf.description: cardless EMI payment method object

cardless_emi.title: CardlessEMI
cardless_emi.description: Request body for cardless emi payment method

channel.description: The channel for cardless EMI is always `link`

phone.description: Customers phone number for this payment instrument. If the customer is not eligible you will receive a 400 error with type as 'invalid_request_error' and code as 'invalid_request_error'

emi_tenure.description: EMI tenure for the selected provider. This is mandatory when provider is one of [`hdfc`, `icici`, `cashe`, `idfc`, `kotak`]

oneOf.title: PaylaterPaymentMethod
oneOf.description: paylater payment method

channel.description: The channel for cardless EMI is always `link`

provider.description: One of ["kotak", "flexipay", "zestmoney", "lazypay", "olapostpaid","simpl", "freechargepaylater"]. Please note that Flexipay is offered by HDFC bank

phone.description: Customers phone number for this payment instrument. If the customer is not eligible you will receive a 400 error with type as 'invalid_request_error' and code as 'invalid_request_error'

offer_id.description: This is required if any offers needs to be applied to the order.

save_card_during_payment.description: Save a plain card for future payments

saved_card.description: pay using instrument id or saved card

token_card.description: Pay using card network token and cryptogram

pay_upi_intent.description: UPI intent. Opens UPI APP. Mobile only

pay_upi_collect.description: Customer will receive a notification on their phone to pay via UPI

pay_upi_collect_redirect.description: Redirect to loader page for UPI Collect

schema.title: OrderPayResponse
schema.description: Order Pay response once you create a transaction for that order

channel.description: One of ["link", "collect", "qrcode"]. In an older version we used to support different channels like 'gpay', 'phonepe' etc. However, we now support only the following channels - link, collect and qrcode. To process payments using gpay, you will have to provide channel as 'link' and provider as 'gpay'

get.description:
Use this API to fetch the order that was created at Cashfree's using the `order_id`. 
## When to use this API
- To check the status of your order
- Once the order is PAID
- Once your customer returns to `return_url`

parameters.name: x-api-version
parameters.description: API version to be used. Format is in YYYY-MM-DD

schema.description: API version to be used

parameters.name: x-request-id
parameters.description: Request id for the API call. Can be used to resolve tech issues. Communicate this in your tech related queries to cashfree

parameters.name: order_id
parameters.description: The id which uniquely identifies your order

schema.title: OrdersEntity
schema.description: The complete order entity

cf_order_id.description: unique id generated by cashfree for your order

order_id.description: order_id sent during the api request

order_currency.description: Currency of the order. Example INR

order_status.description:
Possible values are 
- `ACTIVE`: Order does not have a sucessful transaction yet
- `PAID`: Order is PAID with one successful transaction
- `EXPIRED`: Order was not PAID and not it has expired. No transaction can be initiated for an EXPIRED order.

created_at.description: When the order was created at cashfree's server

customer_details.title: CustomerDetails
customer_details.description: The customer details that are necessary. Note that you can pass dummy details if your use case does not require the customer details.

customer_id.description: A unique identifier for the customer. Use alphanumeric values only.

customer_bank_account_number.description: Customer bank account. Required if you want to do a bank account check (TPV)

customer_bank_ifsc.description: Customer bank IFSC. Required if you want to do a bank account check (TPV)

customer_bank_code.description: Customer bank code. Required for net banking payments, if you want to do a bank account check (TPV)

order_meta.title: OrderMeta
order_meta.description: Optional meta details to control how the customer pays and how payment journey completes

return_url.description: The URL to which user will be redirected to after the payment on bank OTP page. Maximum length: 250. The return_url must contain placeholder {order_id}. When redirecting the customer back to the return url from the bank’s OTP page, Cashfree will replace this placeholder with the actual value for that order.

notify_url.description: Notification URL for server-server communication. Useful when user's connection drops while re-directing. NotifyUrl should be an https URL. Maximum length: 250.

payment_methods.description: Allowed payment modes for this order. Pass comma-separated values among following options - "cc", "dc", "ccc", "ppc","nb","upi","paypal","app","paylater","cardlessemi","dcemi","ccemi","banktransfer". Leave it blank to show all available payment methods

payments.title: PaymentURLObject
payments.description: URL for payment retrieval for an order

refunds.title: RefundURLObject
refunds.description: URL to get refunds for order

order_tags.description: Custom Tags in thr form of {"key":"value"} which can be passed for an order. A maximum of 10 tags can be added

post.description: Use this API to capture or void a preauthorized payment

parameters.name: x-api-version
parameters.description: API version to be used. Format is in YYYY-MM-DD

schema.description: API version to be used

parameters.name: x-request-id
parameters.description: Request id for the API call. Can be used to resolve tech issues. Communicate this in your tech related queries to cashfree

parameters.name: x-idempotency-key
parameters.description:
Idempotency works by saving the resulting status code and body of the first request made for any given idempotency key, regardless of whether it succeeded or failed. Subsequent requests with the same key return the same result, including 500 errors.

Currently supported on all POST calls that uses x-client-id & x-client-secret. To use enable, pass x-idempotency-key in the request header. The value of this header must be unique to each operation you are trying to do. One example can be to use the same order_id that you pass while creating orders

parameters.name: order_id
parameters.description: The id which uniquely identifies your order

requestBody.description: Request body to capture or void a transaction

schema.title: AuthorizationRequest
schema.description: Request to capture or void transaction

action.description: Type of authorization to run. Can be one of 'CAPTURE' , 'VOID'

amount.description: The amount if you are running a 'CAPTURE'

schema.title: PaymentsEntity
schema.description: payment entity full object

error_details.title: ErrorDetailsInPayments
error_details.description: The error details are present only for failed payments

example.error_description: issuer bank or payment service provider declined the transaction

order_amount.description: Order amount can be different from payment amount if you collect service fee from the customer

payment_group.description: Type of payment group. One of ['upi', 'card', 'app', 'netbanking', 'paylater', 'cardless_emi']

payment_time.description: This is the time when the payment was initiated

payment_completion_time.description: This is the time when the payment reaches its terminal state

payment_status.description: The transaction status can be one of  ["SUCCESS", "NOT_ATTEMPTED", "FAILED", "USER_DROPPED", "VOID", "CANCELLED", "PENDING"]

authorization.title: AuthorizationInPayments
authorization.description: If preauth enabled for account you will get this body

captured_amount.description: The captured amount for this authorization request

start_time.description: Start time of this authorization hold (only for UPI)

end_time.description: End time of this authorization hold (only for UPI)

approve_by.description: Approve by time as passed in the authorization request (only for UPI)

action_reference.description: CAPTURE or VOID reference number based on action

payment_completion_time.description: This is the time when the payment reaches its terminal state

approve_by.description: Approve by time as passed in the authorization request (only for UPI)

action_reference.description: CAPTURE or VOID reference number based on action

post.description: Use this API to initiate refunds.

parameters.name: x-api-version
parameters.description: API version to be used. Format is in YYYY-MM-DD

schema.description: API version to be used

parameters.name: x-request-id
parameters.description: Request id for the API call. Can be used to resolve tech issues. Communicate this in your tech related queries to cashfree

parameters.name: x-idempotency-key
parameters.description:
Idempotency works by saving the resulting status code and body of the first request made for any given idempotency key, regardless of whether it succeeded or failed. Subsequent requests with the same key return the same result, including 500 errors.

Currently supported on all POST calls that uses x-client-id & x-client-secret. To use enable, pass x-idempotency-key in the request header. The value of this header must be unique to each operation you are trying to do. One example can be to use the same order_id that you pass while creating orders

parameters.name: order_id
parameters.description: The id which uniquely identifies your order

requestBody.description: Request body to fetch refunds for an order

schema.title: CreateRefundRequest
schema.description: create refund request object

refund_amount.description: Amount to be refunded. Should be lesser than or equal to the transaction amount. (Decimals allowed)

refund_id.description: An unique ID to associate the refund with. Provie alphanumeric values

refund_note.description: A refund note for your reference.

refund_speed.description: Speed at which the refund is processed. It's an optional field with default being STANDARD

items.title: VendorSplit
items.description: Use to split order when cashfree's Easy Split is enabled for your account.

example.description: order amount should be more than equal to 100.12

vendor_id.description: Vendor id created in Cashfree system

amount.description: Amount which will be associated with this vendor

percentage.description: Percentage of order amount which shall get added to vendor account

cf_payment_id.description: Cashfree Payments ID of the payment for which refund is initiated

cf_refund_id.description: Cashfree Payments ID for a refund

order_id.description: Merchant’s order Id of the order for which refund is initiated

refund_id.description: Merchant’s refund ID of the refund

refund_note.description: Note added by merchant for the refund

refund_arn.description: The bank reference number for refund

refund_charge.description: Charges in INR for processing refund

metadata.description: Key-value pair that can be used to store additional information about the entity. Maximum 5 key-value pairs

items.title: VendorSplit
items.description: Use to split order when cashfree's Easy Split is enabled for your account.

example.description: order amount should be more than equal to 100.12

vendor_id.description: Vendor id created in Cashfree system

amount.description: Amount which will be associated with this vendor

percentage.description: Percentage of order amount which shall get added to vendor account

refund_mode.description: Method or speed of processing refund

processed_at.description: Time when refund was processed successfully

refund_speed.title: RefundSpeed
refund_speed.description: How fast refund has to be proecessed

message.description: Error message, if any for refund_speed request

schema.description: Eligiblty API request

order_id.description: OrderId of the order. Either of `order_id` or `order_amount` is mandatory.

oneOf.title: Paylater Offer
oneOf.description: Offer object for paylater

oneOf.title: EMI Offer
oneOf.description: EMI offer object

type.description: Type of emi offer. Possible values are `credit_card_emi`, `debit_card_emi`, `cardless_emi`

post.description: Use this API to create a new payment link. The created payment link url will be available in the API response parameter link_url.

parameters.name: x-api-version
parameters.description: API version to be used. Format is in YYYY-MM-DD

schema.description: API version to be used

parameters.name: x-request-id
parameters.description: Request id for the API call. Can be used to resolve tech issues. Communicate this in your tech related queries to cashfree

parameters.name: x-idempotency-key
parameters.description:
Idempotency works by saving the resulting status code and body of the first request made for any given idempotency key, regardless of whether it succeeded or failed. Subsequent requests with the same key return the same result, including 500 errors.

Currently supported on all POST calls that uses x-client-id & x-client-secret. To use enable, pass x-idempotency-key in the request header. The value of this header must be unique to each operation you are trying to do. One example can be to use the same order_id that you pass while creating orders

requestBody.description: Request body to create a payment link at cashfree

schema.title: CreateLinkRequest
schema.description: Request paramenters for link creation

link_notify.title: link_notify
link_notify.description: Payment link Notify Object for SMS and Email

send_sms.description: If "true", Cashfree will send sms on customer_phone

send_email.description: If "true", Cashfree will send email on customer_email

link_notes.title: link_notes
link_notes.description: Key-value pair that can be used to store additional information about the entity. Maximum 5 key-value pairs

notify_url.description: Notification URL for server-server communication. It should be an https URL.

upi_intent.description: If "true", link will directly open UPI Intent flow on mobile, and normal link flow elsewhere

return_url.description: The URL to which user will be redirected to after the payment is done on the link. Maximum length: 250.

payment_methods.description: Allowed payment modes for this link. Pass comma-separated values among following options - "cc", "dc", "ccc", "ppc", "nb", "upi", "paypal", "app". Leave it blank to show all available payment methods

link_id.description: Unique Identifier (provided by merchant) for the Link. Alphanumeric and only - and _ allowed (50 character limit). Use this for other link-related APIs.

link_amount.description: Amount to be collected using this link. Provide upto two decimals for paise.

link_currency.description: Currency for the payment link. Default is INR. Contact care@cashfree.com to enable new currencies.

link_purpose.description: A brief description for which payment must be collected. This is shown to the customer.

link_partial_payments.description: If "true", customer can make partial payments for the link.

link_minimum_partial_amount.description: Minimum amount in first installment that needs to be paid by the customer if partial payments are enabled. This should be less than the link_amount.

link_expiry_time.description: Time after which the link expires. Customers will not be able to make the payment beyond the time specified here. You can provide them in a valid ISO 8601 time format. Default is 30 days.

link_notify.title: link_notify
link_notify.description: Payment link Notify Object for SMS and Email

send_sms.description: If "true", Cashfree will send sms on customer_phone

send_email.description: If "true", Cashfree will send email on customer_email

link_auto_reminders.description: If "true", reminders will be sent to customers for collecting payments.

link_notes.title: link_notes
link_notes.description: Key-value pair that can be used to store additional information about the entity. Maximum 5 key-value pairs

notify_url.description: Notification URL for server-server communication. It should be an https URL.

upi_intent.description: If "true", link will directly open UPI Intent flow on mobile, and normal link flow elsewhere

return_url.description: The URL to which user will be redirected to after the payment is done on the link. Maximum length: 250.

payment_methods.description: Allowed payment modes for this link. Pass comma-separated values among following options - "cc", "dc", "ccc", "ppc", "nb", "upi", "paypal", "app". Leave it blank to show all available payment methods

get.description: Use this API to view all details and status of a payment link.

parameters.name: x-api-version
parameters.description: API version to be used. Format is in YYYY-MM-DD

schema.description: API version to be used

parameters.name: x-request-id
parameters.description: Request id for the API call. Can be used to resolve tech issues. Communicate this in your tech related queries to cashfree

parameters.name: link_id
parameters.description: The payment link ID for which you want to view the details.

schema.title: LinkCreationResponse
schema.description: Payment link success creation response object

notify_url.description: Notification URL for server-server communication. It should be an https URL.

upi_intent.description: If "true", link will directly open UPI Intent flow on mobile, and normal link flow elsewhere

return_url.description: The URL to which user will be redirected to after the payment is done on the link. Maximum length: 250.

payment_methods.description: Allowed payment modes for this link. Pass comma-separated values among following options - "cc", "dc", "ccc", "ppc", "nb", "upi", "paypal", "app". Leave it blank to show all available payment methods

link_notes.title: link_notes
link_notes.description: Key-value pair that can be used to store additional information about the entity. Maximum 5 key-value pairs

link_notify.title: link_notify
link_notify.description: Payment link Notify Object for SMS and Email

send_sms.description: If "true", Cashfree will send sms on customer_phone

send_email.description: If "true", Cashfree will send email on customer_email

post.description: Use this API to cancel a payment link. No further payments can be done against a cancelled link. Only a link in ACTIVE status can be cancelled.

parameters.name: x-api-version
parameters.description: API version to be used. Format is in YYYY-MM-DD

schema.description: API version to be used

parameters.name: x-request-id
parameters.description: Request id for the API call. Can be used to resolve tech issues. Communicate this in your tech related queries to cashfree

parameters.name: x-idempotency-key
parameters.description:
Idempotency works by saving the resulting status code and body of the first request made for any given idempotency key, regardless of whether it succeeded or failed. Subsequent requests with the same key return the same result, including 500 errors.

Currently supported on all POST calls that uses x-client-id & x-client-secret. To use enable, pass x-idempotency-key in the request header. The value of this header must be unique to each operation you are trying to do. One example can be to use the same order_id that you pass while creating orders

parameters.name: link_id
parameters.description: The payment link ID for which you want to view the details.

schema.description: Response when a payment link is cancelled

return_url.description: The URL to which user will be redirected to after the payment is done on the link. Maximum length: 250.

payment_methods.description: Allowed payment modes for this link. Pass comma-separated values among following options - "cc", "dc", "ccc", "ppc", "nb", "upi", "paypal", "app". Leave it blank to show all available payment methods

link_notes.title: link_notes
link_notes.description: Key-value pair that can be used to store additional information about the entity. Maximum 5 key-value pairs

link_notify.description: Payment link Notify Object for SMS and Email

send_email.description: If "true", Cashfree will send email on customer_email

get.summary: Get Orders for a Payment Link
get.description: Use this API to view all order details for a payment link.

parameters.name: x-api-version
parameters.description: API version to be used. Format is in YYYY-MM-DD

schema.description: API version to be used

parameters.name: x-request-id
parameters.description: Request id for the API call. Can be used to resolve tech issues. Communicate this in your tech related queries to cashfree

parameters.name: link_id
parameters.description: The payment link ID for which you want to view the details.

items.title: OrdersEntity
items.description: The complete order entity

cf_order_id.description: unique id generated by cashfree for your order

order_id.description: order_id sent during the api request

order_currency.description: Currency of the order. Example INR

order_status.description:
Possible values are 
- `ACTIVE`: Order does not have a sucessful transaction yet
- `PAID`: Order is PAID with one successful transaction
- `EXPIRED`: Order was not PAID and not it has expired. No transaction can be initiated for an EXPIRED order.

created_at.description: When the order was created at cashfree's server

customer_details.title: CustomerDetails
customer_details.description: The customer details that are necessary. Note that you can pass dummy details if your use case does not require the customer details.

customer_id.description: A unique identifier for the customer. Use alphanumeric values only.

customer_bank_account_number.description: Customer bank account. Required if you want to do a bank account check (TPV)

customer_bank_ifsc.description: Customer bank IFSC. Required if you want to do a bank account check (TPV)

customer_bank_code.description: Customer bank code. Required for net banking payments, if you want to do a bank account check (TPV)

order_meta.title: OrderMeta
order_meta.description: Optional meta details to control how the customer pays and how payment journey completes

return_url.description: The URL to which user will be redirected to after the payment on bank OTP page. Maximum length: 250. The return_url must contain placeholder {order_id}. When redirecting the customer back to the return url from the bank’s OTP page, Cashfree will replace this placeholder with the actual value for that order.

notify_url.description: Notification URL for server-server communication. Useful when user's connection drops while re-directing. NotifyUrl should be an https URL. Maximum length: 250.

payment_methods.description: Allowed payment modes for this order. Pass comma-separated values among following options - "cc", "dc", "ccc", "ppc","nb","upi","paypal","app","paylater","cardlessemi","dcemi","ccemi","banktransfer". Leave it blank to show all available payment methods

payments.title: PaymentURLObject
payments.description: URL for payment retrieval for an order

refunds.title: RefundURLObject
refunds.description: URL to get refunds for order

order_tags.description: Custom Tags in thr form of {"key":"value"} which can be passed for an order. A maximum of 10 tags can be added

post.description:
- Use this API to get the payment gateway reconciliation details with date range.
- It will have events for your payment account

requestBody.description: Request body to fetch detailed list of transactions

schema.description: Recon object

limit.description: Number of settlements you want to fetch in the next iteration. Maximum limit is 1000, default value is 10.

cursor.description: Specifies from where the next set of settlement details should be fetched.

pagination.description:
To fetch the next set of settlements, pass the cursor received in the response to the next API call. 
 To receive the data for the first time, pass the cursor as null. 
 Limit would be number of settlements that you want to receive.

start_date.description: Specify the start date from when you want the settlement reconciliation details.

end_date.description: Specify the end date till when you want the settlement reconciliation details.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: application/json

parameters.name: x-api-version
parameters.description: API version to be used. Format is in YYYY-MM-DD

schema.description: API version to be used

parameters.name: x-request-id
parameters.description: Request id for the API call. Can be used to resolve tech issues. Communicate this in your tech related queries to cashfree

parameters.name: x-idempotency-key
parameters.description:
Idempotency works by saving the resulting status code and body of the first request made for any given idempotency key, regardless of whether it succeeded or failed. Subsequent requests with the same key return the same result, including 500 errors.

Currently supported on all POST calls that uses x-client-id & x-client-secret. To use enable, pass x-idempotency-key in the request header. The value of this header must be unique to each operation you are trying to do. One example can be to use the same order_id that you pass while creating orders

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: application/json

schema.title: FetchPGRecon
schema.description: Settlement detailed recon response

cursor.description: Specifies from where the next set of settlement details should be fetched.

limit.description: Number of settlements you want to fetch in the next iteration.

event_id.description: Unique ID associated with the event.

event_type.description: The event type can be SETTLEMENT, PAYMENT, REFUND, REFUND_REVERSAL, DISPUTE, DISPUTE_REVERSAL, CHARGEBACK, CHARGEBACK_REVERSAL, OTHER_ADJUSTMENT.

event_settlement_amount.description: Amount that is part of the settlement corresponding to the event.

event_amount.description: Amount of the event. Example, refund amount, dispute amount, payment amount, etc.

sale_type.description: Indicates if it is CREDIT/DEBIT sale.

event_status.description: Status of the event. Example - SUCCESS, FAILED, PENDING, CANCELLED.

event_time.description: Time associated with the event. Example, transaction time, dispute initiation time

order_id.description: Unique order ID. Alphanumeric and only '-' and '_' allowed.

order_amount.description: The amount which was passed at the order creation time.

payment_utr.description: Unique transaction reference number of the payment.

payment_time.description: Date and time when the payment was initiated.

payment_service_charge.description: Service charge applicable for the payment.

payment_service_tax.description: Service tax applicable on the payment.

cf_payment_id.description: Cashfree Payments unique ID to identify a payment.

cf_settlement_id.description: Unique ID to identify the settlement.

settlement_date.description: Date and time when the settlement was processed.

settlement_utr.description: Unique transaction reference number of the settlement.

split_service_charge.description: Service charge that is applicable for splitting the payment.

split_service_tax.description: Service tax applicable for splitting the amount to vendors.

vendor_commission.description: Vendor commission applicable for this transaction.

closed_in_favor_of.description: Specifies whether the dispute was closed in favor of the merchant or customer. /n Possible values - Merchant, Customer

dispute_resolved_on.description: Date and time when the dispute was resolved.

dispute_category.description: Category of the dispute - Dispute code and the reason for dispute is shown.

refund_processed_at.description: Date and time when the refund was processed.

refund_arn.description: The bank reference number for the refund.

refund_note.description: A refund note for your reference.

refund_id.description: An unique ID to associate the refund with.

adjustment.description: Amount that is adjusted from the settlement amount because of any credit/debit event such as refund, refund_reverse etc.

service_tax.description: Service tax applicable on the settlement amount.

service_charge.description: Service charge applicable on the settlement amount.

amount_settled.description: Net amount that is settled after considering the adjustments, settlement charge and tax.

payment_from.description: The start time of the time range of the payments considered for the settlement.

payment_till.description: The end time of time range of the payments considered for the settlement.

settlement_initiated_on.description: Date and time when the settlement was initiated.

settlement_type.description: Type of settlement. Possible values - Standard, Instant, On demand.

settlement_charge.description: Settlement charges applicable on the settlement.

settlement_tax.description: Settlement tax applicable on the settlement.

post.description:
- Use this API to get settlement reconciliation details using Settlement ID, settlement UTR or date range.
- This API will return events for the settlement IDs you want

requestBody.description: Request body to fetch details about settlement

schema.description: Recon Request Object

limit.description: The number of settlements you want to fetch. Maximum limit is 1000, default value is 10.

cursor.description: Specifies from where the next set of settlement details should be fetched.

pagination.description:
To fetch the next set of settlements, pass the cursor received in the response to the next API call. 
 To receive the data for the first time, pass the cursor as null. 
 Limit would be number of settlements that you want to receive.

cf_settlement_ids.description: List of settlement IDs for which you want the settlement reconciliation details.

settlement_utrs.description: List of settlement UTRs for which you want the settlement reconciliation details.

start_date.description: Specify the start date from when you want the settlement reconciliation details.

end_date.description: Specify the end date till when you want the settlement reconciliation details.

filters.description: Specify either the Settlement ID, Settlement UTR, or start date and end date to fetch the settlement details.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: application/json

parameters.name: x-api-version
parameters.description: API version to be used. Format is in YYYY-MM-DD

schema.description: API version to be used

parameters.name: x-request-id
parameters.description: Request id for the API call. Can be used to resolve tech issues. Communicate this in your tech related queries to cashfree

parameters.name: x-idempotency-key
parameters.description:
Idempotency works by saving the resulting status code and body of the first request made for any given idempotency key, regardless of whether it succeeded or failed. Subsequent requests with the same key return the same result, including 500 errors.

Currently supported on all POST calls that uses x-client-id & x-client-secret. To use enable, pass x-idempotency-key in the request header. The value of this header must be unique to each operation you are trying to do. One example can be to use the same order_id that you pass while creating orders

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: application/json

schema.title: FetchSettlementRecon
schema.description: Recon object for settlement

cursor.description: Specifies from where the next set of settlement details should be fetched.

limit.description: Number of settlements you want to fetch in the next iteration.

event_id.description: Unique ID associated with the event.

event_type.description: The event type can be PAYMENT, REFUND, REFUND_REVERSAL, DISPUTE, DISPUTE_REVERSAL, CHARGEBACK, CHARGEBACK_REVERSAL, OTHER_ADJUSTMENT.

event_settlement_amount.description: Amount that is part of the settlement corresponding to the event.

event_amount.description: Amount corresponding to the event. Example, refund amount, dispute amount, payment amount, etc.

sale_type.description: Indicates if it is CREDIT/DEBIT sale.

event_status.description: Status of the event. Example - SUCCESS, FAILED, PENDING, CANCELLED.

event_time.description: Time associated with the event. Example, transaction time, dispute initiation time

order_id.description: Unique order ID. Alphanumeric and only '-' and '_' allowed.

order_amount.description: The amount which was passed at the order creation time.

payment_utr.description: Unique transaction reference number of the payment.

payment_time.description: Date and time when the payment was initiated.

payment_service_charge.description: Service charge applicable for the payment.

payment_service_tax.description: Service tax applicable on the payment.

cf_payment_id.description: Cashfree Payments unique ID to identify a payment.

cf_settlement_id.description: Unique ID to identify the settlement.

settlement_date.description: Date and time when the settlement was processed.

settlement_utr.description: Unique transaction reference number of the settlement.

split_service_charge.description: Service charge that is applicable for splitting the payment.

split_service_tax.description: Service tax applicable for splitting the amount to vendors.

vendor_commission.description: Vendor commission applicable for this transaction.

closed_in_favor_of.description: Specifies whether the dispute was closed in favor of the merchant or customer. Possible values - Merchant, Customer.

dispute_resolved_on.description: Date and time when the dispute was resolved.

dispute_category.description: Category of the dispute - Dispute code and the reason for dispute is shown.

refund_processed_at.description: Date and time when the refund was processed.

refund_arn.description: The bank reference number for refund.

refund_note.description: A refund note for your reference.

refund_id.description: An unique ID associated with the refund.

post.description: Use this API to create new terminals to use softPOS.

parameters.name: x-api-version
parameters.description: API version to be used. Format is in YYYY-MM-DD

schema.description: API version to be used

parameters.name: x-request-id
parameters.description: Request id for the API call. Can be used to resolve tech issues. Communicate this in your tech related queries to cashfree

parameters.name: x-idempotency-key
parameters.description:
Idempotency works by saving the resulting status code and body of the first request made for any given idempotency key, regardless of whether it succeeded or failed. Subsequent requests with the same key return the same result, including 500 errors.

Currently supported on all POST calls that uses x-client-id & x-client-secret. To use enable, pass x-idempotency-key in the request header. The value of this header must be unique to each operation you are trying to do. One example can be to use the same order_id that you pass while creating orders

requestBody.description: Request body to create a Terminal at Cashfree

schema.description: Request body to create a terminal

terminal_name.description: terminal name to be assigned by merchants

terminal_area.description: City where the terminal was created

terminal_phone_no.description: phone number assigned to the terminal

get.summary: Get Static QRs using Terminal ID or Phone Number
get.description: You can fetch all the StaticQRs corresponding to given terminal id or phone number. Provide either the terminal_phone_no or terminal_id in the request.

parameters.name: x-api-version
parameters.description: API version to be used. Format is in YYYY-MM-DD

schema.description: API version to be used

parameters.name: x-request-id
parameters.description: Request id for the API call. Can be used to resolve tech issues. Communicate this in your tech related queries to cashfree

parameters.name: terminal_phone_no
parameters.description: Phone number assigned to the terminal. Required if you are not providing the cf_terminal_id in the request.

parameters.name: cf_terminal_id
parameters.description: Cashfree terminal id for which you want to get staticQRs. Required if you are not providing the terminal_phone_number in the request.

schema.title: Get Static QR
schema.description: QRGet StaticQRs using terminal ID or phone number

bank.description: Name of the bank that is linked to the Static QR.

x-api-version.description: This header has the version of the API. The current version is `2022-09-01`.

x-ratelimit-limit.description: Ratelimit set for your account for this API per minute

x-ratelimit-remaining.description: Rate limit remaning for your account for this API in the next minute. Uses sliding window

x-ratelimit-retry.description:
Contains number of seconds to wait if rate limit is breached
- Is 0 if withing the limit
- Is between 1 and 59 if breached

x-ratelimit-type.description:
either ip or app_id
- `ip` if making a call from the browser. True for api where you don't need `x-client-id` and `x-client-secret`
- `app_id` for authenticated api calls i.e using `x-client-id` and `x-client-secret`

x-request-id.description: Request id for your api call. Is blank or null if no `x-request-id` is sent during the request

x-idempotency-key.description: Idempotency key used during the request. Applicable for POST only

x-idempotency-replayed.description:
In conjunction with `x-idempotency-key` this means
- `true` if the response was replayed
- `false` if the response has not been replayed
